doc.source_uri: 2026-12-31/Bank of China - H First Take 2Q25 a moderate beatBank of China - H First Take 2Q25 a moderate beat_2026-12-31

passages.text: First Take: 2Q25 a moderate beat

Our First Take: 2Q25 - moderate beat. 2Q25 net profit \((+1\%\) y/y) beat JPM by 1ppt, more notably, revenue \((+5\%\) y/y) beat JPM by 4ppt. This is mainly driven by non- NII \((+34\%\) y/y), with fee \(+19\%\) y/y, accelerating from 1Q \((+2\%\) y/y), and non- fee income \(+44\%\) y/y. On the negative side, NII contracted \(6\%\) y/y, the highest contraction among the Big 4 SOE banks peers.

- Robust non-NII growth \((+34\%\) y/y), with fee growth \(+19\%\) y/y: Net fee rose by \(19\%\) y/y (vs 1Q \(+2\%\) y/y), and non-fee income rose by \(44\%\) y/y. 2Q non-NII contributed to \(35\%\) of revenue, the highest among the Big 4 banks.

- Stable asset quality: The NPL ratio was -1bps q/q, SML ratio -3bps h/h, and NPL coverage stable at \(197\%\) . On the negative side, the overdue ratio picked up 13bps h/h in 1H25. Please refer to Table 4-Table 6.

- Accretive impact of new capital: BOC's CET 1 ratio improved 75bps (in line with expectations) to \(12.57\%\) , mainly due to Rmb165bn of capital injection in 2Q, with share count dilution of \(9\%\) .
- NII contracted \(6\%\) y/y, NIM -6bps q/q: NII was 3ppt below JPMe, and NIM is 3bps below our expectations. With the Fed rate cut in 4Q25, there could be downside to NII in 2H25.
- OPEX rose by \(11\%\) y/y: Missed JPMe by 12ppt.
- We expect, muted consensus revisions.
- We expect a moderately positive share price reaction post the 2Q print, but we expect BOC to underperform ICBC and CCB, though we believe it may outperform ABC.
3988. HK, 3988 HK Price: HK\$4.26 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: HK\$5.50 PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026

See page 7 for analyst certification and important disclosures, including non- US analyst disclosures. J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.

Table 7: PnL of BOC's overseas business
Source: BOC financial reports 1H24-1H25.

·Easing concerns on tariff impact: BOC may be more exposed to peers on exported related loans. But we believe China's exporters may be more prepared for tariffs than companies in other regions. Our sensitivity analysis shows that
if US- export related loans' NPL ratio rises to \(20\%\) , impact on BOC's earnings would be \(5\%\) , hence the downside is manageable.

- **Rate cut may ease pressure on credit cost and loan demand:** The recent downward shift of 3M USD yield curve may bring downside to overseas NIM, but upside on loan demand and easing asset quality risk. On net, this is positive for BOC in our view.
- The bank's fee income trend is likely to be stronger than peers: Management cited cross-border settlement business as one of the key drivers, and it expects the trend to continue.

Our Dec-26 price target of HK\(5.50 is based on DDM, using a cost of equity of 11.25\%, a normalized ROE of 8.6\% and a terminal date of 31 December 2027. We derive the valuation for the A-share first and then apply an H-share discount of 15\% for BOC-H.
Key assumptions/parametersNormalised ROE8.6%Cost of capital11.25%Long-term growth4.5%Fair terminal P/BV0.61Dec-26 A-share valuation (RMB)6.00CNY/HKD1.09H-share discount-15%Dec-26 H-share PT (HKD)5.50
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.

J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: \(\mathrm{OW} =\) Overweight, \(\mathrm{N} =\) Neutral, \(\mathrm{UW} =\) Underweight, \(\mathrm{NR} =\) Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we

expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid-cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
